template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a {business_type} that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a telecom operator that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Automatically categorize customer queries, resolve common problems instantly, route complex cases to human agents, and track resolution rates for all interactions.
message.reasoning_content:
Hmm, the user wants a concise single-sentence prompt under 40 words for a telecom support automation workflow. Let me break down the requirements: it needs to cover triage, auto-resolution, escalation, and performance tracking. 

Okay, "customer queries" can cover all incoming issues. "Automatically categorize" handles triage. "Resolve common problems" takes care of simple fixes. "Route complex cases to agents" deals with escalation. "Track all outcomes" satisfies the performance tracking part. 

That's 19 words â€“ well under the limit. The sentence flows logically from intake to resolution tracking, which should meet the user's needs without extra fluff.
